channel.title: Help me moparscape :3
channel.description:
Okay so I recently wanted to build my first PC, i've been studying a lot and I believe I know how to build a PC correctly. If I give you guys the links to parts could you all tell me if it would become a great PC and be able to max out most modern games? The links are below. I would love it if you guys would tell me what I should upgrade/downgrade to be able to max out the next generation of games for about 2 years. Please note I am trying to save a bit of money, so if I need to downgrade to have just "Enough" for a certain part to max out BF3/COD ghosts/the next treyarch game it would be great if you guys would tell me it.
Processor - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819113333 (Updated from the i3)
Case - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811146102 (Updated)
HDD (1TB) - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136533 (Updated from 500GB)
Memory (8GB) - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231445
MOBO - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813130680 (Updated)
Wireless router - We have a family asus wireless router, it's really good but I get 1 bar of signal where i'm at, at my part of the house. If anyone could suggest a router that is under 30$ that I can use in my room, that'd be great.
SSD - (Removed)
PSU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817139027 (Updated, downgraded from 750W)
Mouse - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=9SIA24P0NW1954
GPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814202004 (Updated)
CPU cooler - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835103065 (Just added)
Top 140mm fan - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835228036 (Recently added)
Front and bottom 120mm fan - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811998121 (Recently added)
Thermal paste - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835186038 (Recently added)
Please note this is my first build, I have studied HOW to put it together, but I have not studied what all I have to put in. If anyone will leave suggestions and comments about what I forgot to put in, please do so. Please don't leave negative comments If anyone has any "Expert" tips on building this, please leave some below. Thank you. I also am trying for $600 or less

item.title: Help me moparscape :3
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:21, topic:524824”][quote author=TehEpicMN link=topic=643513.msg4332018#msg4332018 date=1373778809]

Whats to play max on games yet only gets a low grade core i3.

Haha I just realized that, I got a new choice, the AMD A8 bish instead of the intel (I personally hate intel right now)
[/quote]

you hate Intel yet they bulldozer right over most of AMD’s chips.[/quote]
is that a pun?

Read full topic

item.title: Help me moparscape :3
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:16, topic:524824”][quote author=TehEpicMN link=topic=643513.msg4331918#msg4331918 date=1373761346]

I’d recommend switching to Intel for gaming, and if you are going to be using this for gaming, where is the Graphics Card?

Is the Graphics card I have selected really good? Or should I downgrade it to save money?
[/quote]
never cheap out on gfx cards when you are gaming. The core of gaming is the gfx card
7770 is very mediocre at best. get 7850, a tip for a bit future proofing[/quote]the 7850 will be mediocre soon should hold off from buying anything until after the third quarter ends(that’s when a lot of retailers will bring out the new goods)

Read full topic

item.title: Help me moparscape :3
item.dc:creator: @TehEpicMN TehEpicMN
item.description:
@TehEpicMN wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:11, topic:524824”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=643513.msg4331511#msg4331511 date=1373702958]
why is that, mate? If it’s batteries I just buy the standard low-output Sunbeam ones for only like $3.00 for a pack of 8, if it’s the worry that it won’t work on certain surfaces, the one I have literally works on everything, I couldn’t find a surface in my home it wouldn’t work on (worked on my blanket, sheet, bed, desk, table, mouse pad, glass, wood, the hard wood floor, the nylon tile and probably some other ones that I am forgetting.)
[/quote]or pay $50 for rechargeable w/ battery charger that charges in 15 minutes. If I have eight batteries, two go into the keyboard, two go into the mouse, four is always on standby.[/quote]

Lol I don’t have 50$ to spend on a keyboard + Mouse.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me moparscape :3
item.dc:creator: @TehEpicMN TehEpicMN
item.description:
@TehEpicMN wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:6, topic:524824”][quote author=TehEpicMN link=topic=643513.msg4331503#msg4331503 date=1373702190]

You don’t need a mouse pad, especially one for $15.
The mouse + keyboard themselves could be cheaper. Your choice though, since I don’t see you have a budget.

P.S The link to your headset just links to your GPU.

I’d recommend switching to Intel for gaming, and if you are going to be using this for gaming, where is the Graphics Card?

GPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814202004

Haha yeah, I just noticed sorry. I changed the link to what it should be, I also deleted the link to the mouse pad and keyboard since I saw a really nice on in my house haha. If you could, could you link me to a decent, but really cheap mouse? I had a hard time looking for a good one.
[/quote]

I have had the same wireless Logitech mouse for nearly three years, I have never had an issue and it suits me perfect for gaming. (it was $15.00 at Walmart)[/quote]

I honestly love logitech, but I HATE wireless mice to the death

Read full topic

item.title: Help me moparscape :3
item.dc:creator: @TehEpicMN TehEpicMN
item.description:
@TehEpicMN wrote:

Okay so I recently wanted to build my first PC, i’ve been studying a lot and I believe I know how to build a PC correctly. If I give you guys the links to parts could you all tell me if it would become a great PC and be able to max out most modern games? The links are below. I would love it if you guys would tell me what I should upgrade/downgrade to be able to max out the next generation of games for about 2 years. Please note I am trying to save a bit of money, so if I need to downgrade to have just “Enough” for a certain part to max out BF3/COD ghosts/the next treyarch game it would be great if you guys would tell me it.

Processor - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16819113333 (Updated from the i3)

Case - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811146102 (Updated)

HDD (1TB) - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16822136533 (Updated from 500GB)

Memory (8GB) - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820231445

MOBO - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813130680 (Updated)

Wireless router - We have a family asus wireless router, it’s really good but I get 1 bar of signal where i’m at, at my part of the house. If anyone could suggest a router that is under 30$ that I can use in my room, that’d be great.

SSD - (Removed)

PSU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817139027 (Updated, downgraded from 750W)

Mouse - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=9SIA24P0NW1954

GPU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814202004 (Updated)

CPU cooler - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835103065 (Just added)

Top 140mm fan - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835228036 (Recently added)

Front and bottom 120mm fan - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811998121 (Recently added)

Thermal paste - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16835186038 (Recently added)

Please note this is my first build, I have studied HOW to put it together, but I have not studied what all I have to put in. If anyone will leave suggestions and comments about what I forgot to put in, please do so. Please don’t leave negative comments If anyone has any “Expert” tips on building this, please leave some below. Thank you. I also am trying for $600 or less

Read full topic
